Badges

Badges are used to label or categorize information, or call out the current status of a UI element.

Guidelines

Status Type Purpose
Success Use to indicate that a metric or notification is on track or successful. For example, if a system considers 2 or fewer outstanding issues to be successful, and there's 1 outstanding issue.
Warning Use to make user aware of metrics or notifications that have fallen below the success mark, but have not reached critical status.
Danger Use for metrics and notifications that need immediate attention for a user to meet their goals.
Info Use sparingly for Informational metrics or alerts.

Documentation

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. No conversion steps necessary. Status Indicators are new as of UXFrame v2.

Convert from UXFrame v2 to v2018

  1. Remove status-dot-uxf(-lg, -sm) classes. Similar to badges, indicator sizing is now based on the font-size of the parent element.
  2. Change remaining status-dot-uxf(-*) classes to uxf-status-dot(-*) classes
